channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: Belfast: Man arrested after serious sexual assault
item.description: The woman was attacked near Donegall Quay/Queen's Bridge in the early hours of Saturday morning.

item.title: 'We were hurt in bombs through no fault of our own'
item.description: Jennifer McNern lost both her legs and Margaret Yeaman was blinded in separate IRA bomb attacks.

item.title: Danika McGuigan's Wildfire film to premiere in hometown
item.description: Danika McGuigan died in July 2019 shortly after shooting for the film Wildfire concluded.

item.title: Belfast football tournament integrating ethnic communities
item.description: Teams representing 15 nations have been taking part in the second Northern Ireland Confederation Cup.

item.title: Derry: Man arrested after shots fired at republican mural
item.description: The 30-year-old man was arrested under the Terrorism Act on Saturday evening.

item.title: Antrim Coast Half Marathon: Ethiopian Yalemzerf Yehualaw smashes women's world record
item.description: Ethiopian Yalemzerf Yehualaw smashes the women's half marathon world record at the Antrim Coast event in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid: Report finds big rises in garden furniture prices
item.description: Consumer group Which? says one retailer raised the price of a shed by 155% during the past two years.

item.title: All-Ireland Football semi-final: Covid-hit Tyrone stun Kerry by earning 3-14 to 0-22 extra-time triumph
item.description: Tyrone set up an All-Ireland Football Final meeting with Mayo by shocking Kerry 3-14 to 0-22 after extra-time at Croke Park.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Ireland star Jason Smyth to aim for sixth gold after winning his heat in 10.74 seconds
item.description: Irish sprint star Jason Smyth eases into the T13 100m final at the Paralympics after clocking 10.74 seconds in his heat.

item.title: Ireland's Naval Service marks its 75th anniversary
item.description: BBC News NI talks to Irish Navy personnel as the service marks its 75th anniversary.

item.title: Royal Black Institution marks 'Last Saturday' with 28 parades
item.description: Normally there would be six parades but the event is once again being affected by the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: Six more deaths and 1,430 new cases in NI
item.description: In the Republic of Ireland another 1,997 new cases of Covid-19 have been reported.

item.title: Covid-19: Surge in children's issues forecast post-pandemic
item.description: There could be a "generation of invisible children" who missed out on healthcare, says a QUB report.

item.title: Bethany Firth wins swimming gold in Tokyo
item.description: Maisie Summers-Newton and the S14 mixed relay team win golds for Great Britain at the Tokyo Paralympics

item.title: County Antrim: 'Major fish kill' declared at Three Mile Water River
item.description: The Environment Agency says it appears the pollutant contained a significant quantity of a detergent.

item.title: Covid-19: Another 43 virus-related deaths recorded by Nisra
item.description: The agency's total number of Covid-19 related deaths in Northern Ireland now stands at 3,129.

item.title: Covid-19: NI pupils in contact with coronavirus case can stay in class
item.description: Staff who are fully vaccinated will also not have to self isolate if they are a close contact.

item.title: Covid-19: Pandemic had severe impact on young people, says report
item.description: Insufficient consideration was given to the effect on children and young people, says a report.

item.title: High Street voucher scheme to launch after 12 September
item.description: Every adult in Northern Ireland will be eligible for a £100 pre-paid card.

item.title: Covid-19: Samantha Willis' husband speaks of pain of her death
item.description: Josh Willis says he tried to arrange for his wife to hold her newly-born daughter Eviegrace.

item.title: Talking points ahead of new Irish Premiership season
item.description: As the Irish Premiership campaign of 2020-21 prepares to kick off this weekend, we examine some of the big points of discussion ahead of the new season.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Bracken bashing in the Castlerock countryside
item.description: Environmentalists are trying to help native species and wildlife to thrive in the coastal area

item.title: High pressure driving dry weather in Northern Ireland
item.description: Dry weather is expected over the next seven days, with warm temperatures set to peak on Wednesday.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Meet Northern Ireland's Paralympians
item.description: With the Tokyo Paralympics getting underway a year later than planned, meet the seven Northern Irish athletes ready to compete in Tokyo

item.title: Boris Johnson's Irish Sea tunnel vision - roadworthy or pipe dream?
item.description: A BBC documentary asks how serious is Boris Johnson about a link from Scotland to Northern Ireland?

item.title: The fishing group supporting men with their mental health
item.description: Thomas Campbell, who suffered with addiction, set up the fishing group as a safe space for men.

item.title: Brexit: Irish government harming NI ties with UK, says Donaldson
item.description: The DUP leader says relations between Dublin and Belfast could become untenable over the NI Protocol.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: Fly through the home of Ulster Rugby with BBC Sport NI
item.description: Take a flight through the home of Ulster Rugby with BBC Sport NI as we prepare to bring you live United Rugby Championship matches this season across TV, online and radio.

item.title: Brexit: EU ready to respond to NI Protocol concerns, says Martin
item.description: The taoiseach accepts that unionists have "genuine concerns" about the Northern Ireland Protocol.

item.title: Sinn Féin needed shake up in Foyle, says McDonald
item.description: The party leader visits the Foyle constituency as nominations open to replace the party's MLAs there.

item.title: Londonderry: More than 200 parking fines to be refunded
item.description: The Department for Infrastructure admits rule changes were made "without the usual advisory period".

item.title: Afghanistan: Londonderry-based Afghan fears for family
item.description: An Afghan man living in Derry says he has not heard from his family in Kabul for six days.

item.title: Police step up Moygashel patrols after Dungannon Park trouble
item.description: There were reports of a group of masked men patrolling Dungannon Park.

item.title: County Meath: Murder investigation after man's body found
item.description: The 19-year-old's body was found with a single gunshot wound in County Meath.

item.title: Ireland and France links never been stronger, says Martin after Macron visit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron meets the Irish president and the taoiseach on a visit to Dublin.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish emergency mission helps 36 people out of country
item.description: The Irish government says it will continue its effort to help Irish citizens in crisis-hit Kabul.

item.title: Beacon Hospital: School 'did not solicit' Covid vaccines
item.description: The Beacon Hospital in Dublin had administered 20 Covid-19 vaccines to teachers at a private school.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish citizens wait for rescue mission
item.description: Troops and diplomats are assist more than 30 people who are struggling to get to Kabul airport.
